item.title: Naming Convention
item.description: Define Naming conventions are systems of rules to use when naming variables, constants, methods, and other components of codes. With consistent application, it makes code easier to read, understand, and search. Principal Terms class: in object-oriented programming, a category of related objects that share common variables and methods. constant: in computer programming, a value that does not change, or an identifier assigned to represent such a value. method: in object-oriented programming, a procedure or function specific to objects of a particular class.
